items.title: Joey Veerman over waarom zijn transfer naar Fenerbah√ße stukliep
items.summary: Een transfer van Joey Veerman (27) van PSV naar Fenerbah√ße ketste af. In Estepona vertelde hij zondag voor het eerst zijn kant van het verhaal. De middenvelder heeft het transferboek gesloten en wil nog √©√©n keer op de platte kar staan.

items.title: Reed deserves all the credit for a moment of 'pure inspiration'- Silva
items.summary: Fulham manager Marco Silva reacts to his team's 2-2 draw against Liverpool with Harrison Reed scoring a stunning 97th-minute equaliser in a moment of "pure inspiration".

items.title: Gakpo dacht ook dat hij de winnende had gemaakt: 'Ongelukkig'
items.summary: Bij Liverpool balen ze van het gelijkspel tegen Fulham. The Reds dachten door een late goal van Cody Gakpo de volle buit te pakken, maar in de allerlaatste seconden ging het alsnog mis voor de landskampioen.

items.title: Deze route moet Marokko afleggen om de Afrika Cup te winnen
items.summary: Als groepswinnaar begint Marokko zondag aan de knock-outfase van de Afrika Cup. De Leeuwen van de Atlas krijgen steeds beter zicht op welke landen er moeten worden verslagen om het heilige doel te kunnen verzilveren: toernooiwinst. Deze landen moeten worden verslagen om dat te laten lukken.

items.title: VI Live: Manchester City ziet Reijnders scoren na kansenregen tegen Chelsea
items.summary: In deze VI Live volgen we de hoogtepunten in verschillende competities. Met onder meer aandacht voor Leeds United - Manchester United, Fulham - Liverpool, de Afrika Cup en Real Madrid - Real Betis.

items.title: 'It's not enough'- Slot frustrated with Fulham draw
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "it's not enough" for his side to rely on late goals after a "frustrating" 2-2 draw against Fulham at Craven Cottage.

items.title: Aberdeen sack manager Thelin
items.summary: Aberdeen have sacked manager Jimmy Thelin after 18 months in charge.

items.title: Littler on his next challenger: MVG said a star is born every 17 years!
items.summary: The question on everyone's lips: Is there a player in darts who will challenge Luke Littler for the next 10-15 years? The reality is we may not have heard of them yet.

items.title: 'Rookgordijnen optrekken als iedereen precies weet wie de nieuwe bondscoach wordt'
items.summary: Prachtig nieuws. Ibrahim Afellay leidde in Spanje, samen met Peter Bosz, zijn eerste PSV-training. Ergens halverwege viel het licht uit. Nu hoop ik zo dat daar beelden van zijn en dat een meegereisde Nederlandse journalist Afellay heeft ge√Ønterviewd. Afellay met een zaklamp onder zijn kin en dan die heerlijke Ibrahim-zinnetjes achter elkaar.

items.title: Rice on Gy√∂keres: Wouldn't be top without him
items.summary: Declan Rice has defended goal-shy Viktor Gy√∂keres, claiming Arsenal will not be able to end their 22-year wait for a Premier League title without him.

items.title: Amorim hits out: I'm Utd manager, not the coach
items.summary: Ruben Amorim has raised doubts over his future at Manchester United by saying he wants to be the "manager, not the coach."

items.title: Reed stunner forces late Liverpool draw at Fulham
items.summary: Liverpool's hopes of finishing in the Premier League's top four received a damaging blow as Fulham's Harrison Reed struck one of the goals of the season.

items.title: Aaronson scores as Leeds hold Man United
items.summary: Matheus Cunha cancelled out Brenden Aaronson's strike as Ruben Amorim's Manchester United and rivals Leeds fought out a tense 1-1 draw at rocking Elland Road.

items.title: Beating Palace 'a big step forward' - Howe
items.summary: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe says his team's 2-0 win over Crystal Palace represents "a big step forward", as The Magpies look to build momentum in their Premier League season.

items.title: Rangers defender Sterling arrested over traffic offences after Old Firm victory
items.summary: Rangers defender Dujon Sterling was arrested following his side's victory in the Old Firm game against Celtic on Saturday.

items.title: Live on Sky: Leicester vs West Brom
Prem Rugby: Leicester record big win vs Saracens to close in on top four
items.summary: Adam Radwan scored two tries as Leicester kept in contention for a play-off spot with an impressive 36-28 win over Saracens.

items.title: Reed‚Äôs rocket rescues Fulham point and denies Liverpool in thrilling finish
items.summary: Perhaps they underestimated Harrison Reed. Certainly there was little reaction when the ball came back to the Fulham substitute with 96 minutes gone at Craven Cottage. Liverpool simply stood off Reed, almost daring the midfielder to shoot, and were made to regret their lack of urgency when one of Fulham‚Äôs more unfashionable players rescued a point for Marco Silva‚Äôs stubborn side by ripping a stunning shot into Alisson Becker‚Äôs top corner. It was only the popular 30-year-old‚Äôs fourth goal in six years in west London, and it said a lot about the state of Liverpool this season. The champions, after all, had just gone 2-1 up through Cody Gakpo and should have defended their lead with more determination. Instead their complacency gave Fulham hope and left Arne Slot‚Äôs side ruing a missed opportunity to tighten their grip on fourth place. Continue reading...

items.title: Guimar√£es and Thiaw fire Newcastle to victory as Palace‚Äôs winless run goes on
items.summary: Eddie Howe describes January as ‚Äúseason defining‚Äù for his side and Newcastle‚Äôs manager looked suitably delighted to kick it off by collecting three points as Crystal Palace‚Äôs winless run continued. Yet snapshots of a beaming Howe allied with the bald statistics do not quite tell the story of an often chaotic meeting of the Carabao Cup and FA Cup holders. By the 78th minute, when a corner was dropped for Malick Thiaw to poke the ball past Dean Henderson, the disappointment writ large across Oliver Glasner‚Äôs face suggested the Crystal Palace manager knew the game was up. Continue reading...
